description: 共同科英文（二）課程為一學期兩學分課程，係為非英語系學生所開設的課程。目標在幫助大一學生活用中學時期所累積的英語知識，提昇英語聽、說、讀、寫整體的溝通能力。為達此目標，本課程要求教師盡量用英語上課，努力營造一個豐富的英語環境，讓學生不但有充分機會以英語參與課堂活動，且樂於使用英語與同學及老師溝通。
goals: 1. 增進學生英語溝通表達能力 2. 透過參與課程活動促進團隊精神 3. 透過多面向英語閱讀促使學生了解多元文化，拓展學生國際化視野 4. 透過課堂討論培養批判精神 5. 提升學生英語學習動機及自主學習興趣
syllabus:
**Objectives**: This course is designed to support college freshmen’s in their use of English language in academic context and to **improve their reading proficiency****.** However, this semester the class also concentrates on **build****ing** **up students’ proficiency** **in** **listening, speaking and writing** through activities that integrate the four language skills. The objectives of this class include developing students’ **(1)** effective English reading skills, **(2)** fluency in expressing ideas in oral and written forms in English, and **(3)** English presentation skills. In order to do so, there a **four-pronged approach** to the course:

**1)** Firstly, **the course textbook** emphasizes vocabulary learning and building in order to provide students the structure and tools to acquire new words. Furthermore, the textbook helps improve reading proficiency and develop practical critical thinking. Students will need to **write two short critical essays** based on the five readings done in class, while there will be **three Chapter Reviews** in the form of Kahoots or games, which will quiz student comprehension.

**2)** Secondly, over the course of the first-half of the semester, students will undertake one major **task-based presentation project**, in which task groups, of no more than 3 students per group, are asked to **investigate areas and topics** that are **of serious interest to themselves**, and then **present their work** to the class.

**3)** Thirdly, you are advised to **visit the Self-Access Room** (Main campus **樸****101**) **and/or** **English Chat Room** (Gongguan Library or Main Campus **樸****102**), do iqonlinepractice and/or read Lexile books as much as you can. You are expected to visit them for at least **_10 hours_** in total this semester. Alternatively, you **may partake in the** **ppt presentation competition** or provide **proof of of alternative learning**.

**4)** Finally, over the course of the second-half of the semester, there will also be various **supplementary materials**. These will vary over a range of areas, so that students can to familiarize themselves with topical language and set you up for the mandatory **Lexile** given by the University which will count as your final exam.

**N.B: All elements to the course will be evaluated and assessed**.   

**Textbook:** Daise, D., Norloff, C., & Carne, P. (2011) Q: Skills for Success: Reading and Writing, 4. New York: Oxford University Press. **(Second Edition!)**

**Textbook Online Practice:** [www.iQQonlinePractice.com](http://www.iQQonlinePractice.com)

**Materials:** A **Notebook** for taking notes on new vocabulary, phrases, grammar, task project, homework, autonomous work and critical thinking assignments.

**Guidelines and Requirements: The Ten Commandments!**

1.  Punctual attendance is required as there are constant assignments throughout the course. **Talk to or email me** if you can’t attend class.
2.  This is a **Flip Class**. **Homework must be done** for the class to work properly. This includes **reviewing** and **previewing** class chapters.
3.  **Actively participate** in class discussions.
4.  **Grades will be reduced** for each failure to attend class without reason, excessive lateness, lack of participation or failure to do homework. 
5.  You need to **submit** homework **_several times_** during the semester. **Homework,** assignments and paragraph essays **must** **be done and be on time**.
6.  , tablets, etc, must be **turned off** unless needed in class.
7.  **No eating** during class, but **drinks are allowed**.

10.   **Optional Listening Practice:** Students should do extra **practice their English autonomously** every chance they get. Any English-language encounters can be recorded in your Class Journal for potential **extra grade**!

**1)** Attendance, Participation & Homework: 10%

**2)** Presentation Task Project: 20% (Presentation: 15%, Drafts/Reflection: 10%)

**3)** Chapter Reviews (kahoots and games): 15%
